intro: Parrya runcinata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parrya, is a species of flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Parrya runcinata is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
